condition.description:
Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a problem that affects the large intestine. It can cause abdominal cramping, bloating, and a change in bowel habits. Some people with the disorder have constipation. Some have diarrhea. Others go back and forth between the two. Although IBS can cause a great deal of discomfort, it does not harm the intestines.

IBS is common. It affects about twice as many women as men and is most often found in people younger than 45 years. No one knows the exact cause of IBS. There is no specific test for it. Your doctor may run tests to be sure you don't have other diseases. These tests may include stool sampling tests, blood tests, and x-rays. Your doctor may also do a test called a sigmoidoscopy or colonoscopy. Most people diagnosed with IBS can control their symptoms with diet, stress management, probiotics, and medicine.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
indications: chronic diarrhea from irritable bowel syndrome
condition.name: Irritable bowel syndrome

indications: Chronic diarrhea from Irritable Bowel Syndrome

userStories.tip: Combined with lomotil causes me to be light headed and dizzy.

carousel_items: Don't drink alcohol while on Librax.
Don't stop taking Librax suddenly without talking to your doctor.
Take 1 to 2 capsules 3 or 4 times a day before meals and drink plenty of liquids to stay hydrated.
Don't drive or do anything that requires concentration until you know how your body reacts to Librax.
Librax should be used with other medications to control your stomach and bowel symptoms.
Can cause drowsiness, dizziness, dry mouth, or constipation.

basics.benefits_moa: Librax is a combination medication that controls symptoms of IBS. Chlordiazepoxide (a benzodiazepine) controls anxiety and clidinium (an antispasmodic) reduces the amount of secretions your stomach and intestines make.
basics.bottom_line: Librax is used with other medications to help control ulcers and irritable bowel syndrome. It just can't be used on its own.
downsides: Isn't meant to be used by itself for treating IBS and ulcers.
If you want to stop taking Librax, you have to talk to your doctor since stopping cold turkey can cause withdrawal symptoms.

downsides_processed.orig: Isn't meant to be used by itself for treating IBS and ulcers.
If you want to stop taking Librax, you have to talk to your doctor since stopping cold turkey can cause withdrawal symptoms.

upsides: Can be used with other medications to help control the symptoms of ulcers and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
Available as a generic, so it should be reasonably priced.

upsides_processed.orig: Can be used with other medications to help control the symptoms of ulcers and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
Available as a generic, so it should be reasonably priced.

drugs.one_liner: Treats irritable bowel syndrome and ulcers.

userStories.tip: Helped with general anxiety disorder

drugs.name: Librax

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't drink alcohol while on Librax.
Don't stop taking Librax suddenly without talking to your doctor.
Take 1 to 2 capsules 3 or 4 times a day before meals and drink plenty of liquids to stay hydrated.
Don't drive or do anything that requires concentration until you know how your body reacts to Librax.
Librax should be used with other medications to control your stomach and bowel symptoms.
Can cause drowsiness, dizziness, dry mouth, or constipation.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in behavior
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Librax who reported changes in behavior and their mood. If you feel overly excited, stimulated or with sudden rage for no reason, talk to your doctor to see if you need to change medications.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Librax who reported changes in behavior and their mood. If you feel overly excited, stimulated or with sudden rage for no reason, talk to your doctor to see if you need to change medications.

risks_warnings.title: Overdose
risks_warnings.description: Don't take more than the recommended dose of Librax of 2 capsules per day. Symptoms of overdose include problems walking and with movement, confusion and oversedation. If you find that Librax is not helping you at the maximum dose, talk to your doctor to see if you need to change medications.

description_processed.orig: Don't take more than the recommended dose of Librax of 2 capsules per day. Symptoms of overdose include problems walking and with movement, confusion and oversedation. If you find that Librax is not helping you at the maximum dose, talk to your doctor to see if you need to change medications.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Librax lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Librax lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Memory problems
risks_warnings.description: You may not be able to make new memories. This is a risk associated with all benzodiazepines, like Librax.

description_processed.orig: You may not be able to make new memories. This is a risk associated with all benzodiazepines, like Librax.

carousel_items: Psyllium works in about 12-72 hours for constipation.
It's important to take each dose with at least 8 ounces (a full glass) of water or other liquid (not hot liquids).
Mix powder well and drink right away up to 3 times a day (build up to this slowly), but not for more than one week.
Don't take Psyllium within 2 hours before or after taking other medicines. It may interact and affect how they work.
If you take Psyllium then have chest pain, vomiting, trouble breathing or swallowing, get medical help immediately.
Ask your doctor before taking Psyllium if you have stomach pain, nausea, vomiting or had sudden changes in your stool for more than 2 weeks.
Ask your doctor about giving Psyllium to anyone younger than 12 years.
Stop taking Psyllium and call your doctor if you have pain, swelling or bulging in your belly, rectal bleeding or have not had a bowel movement after taking.
Talk to you doctor about eating certain foods and getting more exercise to help prevent your constipation.

basics.benefits_moa: Psyllium is a fiber-based laxative. It adds bulk and moisture to your intestine, which softens stool and makes it easier to pass.
basics.bottom_line: The natural psyllium fiber in Psyllium does more than relieve constipation. It lowers cholesterol, keeps blood sugar levels healthy, and makes you feel less hungry between meals.
downsides: You may have to take Psyllium daily for 1-3 days to see full effects.
If you don't take it with enough liquid, it could swell, block your throat and cause choking.
Not the best choice for people who have swallowing problems or aren't able to drink lots of liquids.
Psyllium contains psyllium. Don't take if you have an allergy to psyllium from breathing it in or swallowing it.
Can cause gas and mild belly cramps.

downsides_processed.orig: You may have to take Psyllium daily for 1-3 days to see full effects.
If you don't take it with enough liquid, it could swell, block your throat and cause choking.
Not the best choice for people who have swallowing problems or aren't able to drink lots of liquids.
Psyllium contains psyllium. Don't take if you have an allergy to psyllium from breathing it in or swallowing it.
Can cause gas and mild belly cramps.

upsides: Psyllium is the most recommended brand of natural fiber laxative
Some people feel that taking Psyllium is a hassle, but most think it's worth it.
It has multiple health benefits, good to control your hunger between meals, improves your blood sugar and lowers cholesterol levels.
Studies show it works better than a stool softener for constipation.

It's important to take each dose with at least 8 ounces (a full glass) of water or other liquid (not hot liquids).
Mix powder well and drink right away up to 3 times a day (build up to this slowly), but not for more than one week.
Don't take Psyllium within 2 hours before or after taking other medicines. It may interact and affect how they work.
If you take Psyllium then have chest pain, vomiting, trouble breathing or swallowing, get medical help immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Bowel blockage
risks_warnings.description: Stop taking Psyllium and call your doctor right away if you have nausea, vomiting, pain or bulging in your belly that doesn't go away, have rectal bleeding, and no bowel movement after taking. These may be symptoms of a bowel blockage (bowel obstruction) which is serious.
risk_factors: Other condition that causes blockage or narrowing of bowel

description_processed.orig: Stop taking Psyllium and call your doctor right away if you have nausea, vomiting, pain or bulging in your belly that doesn't go away, have rectal bleeding, and no bowel movement after taking. These may be symptoms of a bowel blockage (bowel obstruction) which is serious.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Psyllium can cause allergic reaction and life-threatening organ failure. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Psyllium can cause allergic reaction and life-threatening organ failure. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

carousel_items: Take at bedtime to avoid some of its side effects.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, constipation, and weight gain.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

basics.benefits_moa: Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It may change serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood and pain perception. It also has sedative effects.
basics.bottom_line: Amitriptyline is an older antidepressant that's sometimes used to treat pain and sleep problems, but it can have more side effects than similar medications.
downsides: When used for depression, Amitriptyline causes more side effects and has a higher risk of overdose than other antidepressants. It's usually used when other medications haven't worked.
It's more likely to cause sleepiness, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

downsides_processed.orig: When used for depression, Amitriptyline causes more side effects and has a higher risk of overdose than other antidepressants. It's usually used when other medications haven't worked.
It's more likely to cause sleepiness, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

upsides: Low doses work well to treat certain kinds of chronic pain. It can take 2 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
Low doses of Amitriptyline start working in 45 minutes to help you sleep better.
Six out of every ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.

userStories.tip: Could not wake up and function properly. Never again.

Start really low (5 mg) and increase slowly (5 mg increase) every week to two weeks to avoid foggy brain feeling. I took it once before and didn't do this. I quit after several weeks because of foggy brain thing. This time - no problems.
Some people use this to prevent their headaches. It works for some, but didn't for me. I'm not saying it won't be worth it for you, but I wasn't helped.
Active with familial arthritis, fibromyalgia, old injury.

userStories.identifier: 25 year old with undiagnosable hip pain
userStories.tip: Makes you really sleepy until you adjust to it.
Used to treat undiagnosable hip pain that has occurred for 8 years.
It sure works for preventing migrains but it made me gain weight.
First few weeks are disruptive but after that it works great

My migraines have reduced in frequency and duration so much that it feels like a miracle. My doctor titrated me up to 25mcg and I take it every night before I go to bed. Love it! It has given me my life back!

I'm using this to treat depression, and insomnia which was caused by my primary medication. I take half of a 5mg tablet before bed and it knocks me out. Anymore and I'm very tired the next day. It has worked perfectly for my needs.
Been an insomniac all my life. Very little results from anything else.
Helped sleep at bedtime. Not as effective as Trazodone, but kept me asleep without waking up in pain.

drugs.name: Elavil

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take at bedtime to avoid some of its side effects.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, constipation, and weight gain.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Amitriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Amitriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control compared to other antidepressants. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control compared to other antidepressants. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Anticholinergic effects
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline blocks acetylcholine, a nervous system chemical involved in many major bodily functions. Therefore, this medication commonly causes symptoms such as dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, dizziness, and higher risk of falls.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline blocks acetylcholine, a nervous system chemical involved in many major bodily functions. Therefore, this medication commonly causes symptoms such as dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, dizziness, and higher risk of falls.

carousel_items: Try to drink plenty of clear liquids. Having diarrhea can make you dehydrated.
The correct dose of Imodium may be different depending on age. Use the dosing chart to find the right amount of medicine based on age and weight.
Shake Imodium liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
Check with your baby doctor before using if you're breastfeeding.
Ask your doctor before taking Imodium if you have a fever, liver problems, mucus in your stool or are taking antibiotics.
Don't use if you have blood in your stool or it's dark or black in color.
Stop using Imodium and call your doctor if you have pain, swelling or bulging in your belly or your symptoms get worse after 2 days. This could be serious.

basics.benefits_moa: Imodium is an antidiarrheal medicine. It's actually an opioid related to morphine, though it doesn't affect the brain like opioid pain medicines do. Instead, it works directly on muscles in your large intestine to stop contractions and increase the time it takes for stool to move through. The result is less diarrhea and more formed stool.
basics.bottom_line: One day is too many days to have diarrhea. Having Imodium on hand to relieve your symptoms can be a life-saver.
downsides: Imodium only treats your diarrhea symptoms. Diarrhea may be caused by a number of conditions and will need specific treatment that deals with the underlying issue.

Studies in people taking Imodium for chronic diarrhea showed if the maximum number of doses didn't relieve symptoms in 10 days, then it probably won't work for that condition. You can talk to your doctor about other treatment options.

downsides_processed.orig: Imodium only treats your diarrhea symptoms. Diarrhea may be caused by a number of conditions and will need specific treatment that deals with the underlying issue.

Studies in people taking Imodium for chronic diarrhea showed if the maximum number of doses didn't relieve symptoms in 10 days, then it probably won't work for that condition. You can talk to your doctor about other treatment options.

upsides: Most people who take Imodium feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.
Imodium is used for short-term, chronic and traveler's diarrhea. It's also used for people who have diarrhea caused by cancer or certain medicines that treat cancer.

upsides_processed.orig: Most people who take Imodium feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.
Imodium is used for short-term, chronic and traveler's diarrhea. It's also used for people who have diarrhea caused by cancer or certain medicines that treat cancer.

userStories.tip: Generic loperamide is cheaper and works just as well as Imodium.
Drink plenty of water

Shake Imodium liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
Check with your baby doctor before using if you're breastfeeding.

Don't use if you have blood in your stool or it's dark or black in color.
Stop using Imodium and call your doctor if you have pain, swelling or bulging in your belly or your symptoms get worse after 2 days. This could be serious.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Very rarely, Imodium has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Very rarely, Imodium has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Liver problems
risks_warnings.description: Imodium is broken down by the liver. If you have liver problems, talk to your doctor. You may need a different dose, (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label) or another medicine to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Imodium is broken down by the liver. If you have liver problems, talk to your doctor. You may need a different dose, (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label) or another medicine to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Serious intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Do not use if you have diarrhea with a high fever, blood in your stool, pain, swelling or bulging in your belly. People taking HIV medicine together with Imodium can have a serious intestinal problem called toxic megacolon.  Call your doctor or get medical care right away if you develop these symptoms or your diarrhea gets worse after 2 days.

description_processed.orig: Do not use if you have diarrhea with a high fever, blood in your stool, pain, swelling or bulging in your belly. People taking HIV medicine together with Imodium can have a serious intestinal problem called toxic megacolon.  Call your doctor or get medical care right away if you develop these symptoms or your diarrhea gets worse after 2 days.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Using Imodium is not recommended during pregnancy or if you're breast-feeding. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Using Imodium is not recommended during pregnancy or if you're breast-feeding. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.
